He will take the lion's share.

As soon as he has sucked you dry, he will say good-bye.

content:
しる〔知る〕
〈他動〉
1. To know (a person or thing―of or about a person or thing); to be acquainted with (a person); to be familiar with (a thing); to be informed (about the state of things); to be aware of(a fact); to be sensible of (kindness); to be conscious of (one's powers); to be awake to (one's interests); to be alive to (the feelings of honour); to be privy to (a secret); to be no stranger to (poverty):(初めて知る)to learn

content.content: 君はあの人を知っているか
I know him―I am acquainted with him.
そういう人のあることはかねて噂に聞いて知っているが詳しいことは知らぬ
I know of such a man, but I do not know well about him.
Everybody knows him―He is known to everybody.
He knows nothing―He is ignorant of everything.
そんなこととは知らなかった
I was not aware of the fact.
彼は沙翁{しゃおう=シェークスピア}の作をよく知っている
He is familiar with Shakespeare―Shakespeare is familiar to him.
天知る地知る我が身知る
God knows, and so does my conscience.
木の善し悪しはその実を見て知れ
A tree is known by its fruit.
人の善悪はその交わる友を見て知れ
“A man is known by the company he keeps.”
彼は敵味方の区別をも知らぬ
He does not know friend from foe.
僕は生徒の顔は知っているが
I know the students by sight.
I do not know them by name.
僕を知らぬようでは君はまだ世に知られぬと見える
Not to know me argues yourself unknown.
Like knows like―“Deep calleth unto deep.”
一を知って二を知らぬ
He knows only one side of the question.
町内で知らぬは亭主ばかりなり
“The good man is the only one who does not know what is amiss at home.”
それとは知らずに人を害した
I injured a man without knowing it―unwittingly.
彼は知らぬと言っている
He says he does not know―He denies his knowledge.
彼はどこまでも知らぬ知らぬと言い張っている
He persists in denying his knowledge.
彼らは英語の初歩をも知らぬ
They do not know the elements of English―They are ignorant of the rudiments of the language.
彼はそんな法律のあることを知らなかったと言っている
法律は知らぬで通らぬ
Ignorance is no plea with the law.
そんな危険があろうとは夢にも知らなかった
I was unconscious of any such danger.
知らずして犯せるものは罪無し
No blame attaches to the unconscious doer of wrong.
人を知らないから選ぶのに当てが無い
My ignorance of the men obliges me to choose at random.
知らざるを知らずとせよ、これ知るなり
Confess your ignorance, and you will escape ignorance.
己が利益を知る者は少ない
Few men are awake to their own interests.
人は己が利益を知らぬものだ
People will be blind to their own interests.
あの男は恩を知らぬ(恩知らずだ)
He is insensible of favours―Kindness is thrown away upon him―He is an ingrate.
to be sensible to shame―alive to the feelings of honour
The Japanese are keenly alive to the feelings of honour.
to awake to the stern realities of life
He is a stranger to me.
He is an utter stranger―a complete stranger―a perfect stranger―to me.
君は貧乏の味を知るまい
You do not know what it is to be poor―You are a stranger to poverty.
僕は貧乏の味を知っている
I know what it is to be poor―I am no stranger to poverty.
彼は秘密を知っているに違いない
He must be privy to the secret―in the secret.
彼は世間の事情をよく知っている
He is well informed about the world.
彼はよくものを知っている
He is well informed―full of information.
君はどうしてあの人を知っているか
How came you to know him?
君はどうして彼を米探と知ったか
How did you know him for a spy?
僕の知っているところではそういう人は無いようだ
There is no such man that I know of―to my knowledge.
僕の知っているところでは彼は洋行したことは無いようだ
He has not been abroad that I know of―to the best of my belief.
その所行が警官の知るところとなった
His doings came to the knowledge of the police―came to the ears of the police.→『しらずしらず〔不知不識〕』→『しらぬかお〔知らぬ顔〕』→『しらぬなか〔知らぬ仲〕』→『しらぬふり〔知らぬ振り〕』→『しらぬまに〔知らぬ間に〕』

content:
2. 
〈以下特例〉

content.content: 病気というものはどんなものだか少しも知らぬ(さらに知らぬ、まるで知らぬ)
I have no idea of what an illness is like.
薬の味は夢にも知らない
I have not the slightest idea of―have not the faintest notion of―what medicine tastes like.
君がこの金を取っても誰も知る者が無い
You can take the money, and nobody will be the wiser―without anybody being the wiser.
彼はこの金を取られても知らずにいる
He will have this money taken, and be none the wiser.
閑談時の移るを知らず
We took no note of time while chatting.
チベットは外界には全く知られていない
Thibet is a sealed letter―a sealed book―to the outer world.
知らざるは誤るに勝る
彼は甘いも辛いも知っている
He has tasted the sweets and bitters of life.
彼はその女をキズ物と知りつつ貰ったのだ
He married her with open eyes.
新聞によって日日の出来事を知る
We depend on the newspaper for the news of daily events.
“A word to the wise is sufficient.”
長州にその人ありと知られる高杉晋作であった
It was Takasugi Shinsaku of Choshu fame.
入り来たりしはなんぞ知らん校長その人ならんとは
Who should come in but the principal himself?
碇泊せる船の数幾百なるを知らず
Hundreds of ships lie at anchor.
失敗する者の数幾千なるを知らず
相知る者は汝と我のみ

content: 3. (=真価を知る)to appreciate

content.content: 天才は世に知られぬことがある
A genius is not always appreciated.
彼は世に知られぬ天才だ
士は己を知る人の為に死す
A samurai dies for one who appreciates him.
天下遂に我を知る者無きか
Is there none in the world who can appreciate me?
Those will appreciate it who can.

content: 4. (=推して知る)to infer; to conjecture

content.content: to infer the whole from one
その人格の偉大なるこの一事をもって知るべし
His greatness may be inferred from this fact―This fact shows his greatness.
その前途知るべきのみ
Its future is not hard to conjecture.

content: 5. (=与り知る)to be concerned with (a person or thing); to have concern with (a matter); to have to do with (a person or thing)

content.content: 僕はそんなことは知らん
I will have no concern with such matters―have nothing to do with such matters―have nothing to say to such matters.
それは僕の知ったことじゃない
That's no concern of mine―no business of mine―none of my business.
君の知ったことじゃない
That's no concern of yours―no business of yours―none of your business.
後はどうなろうと僕は知らん
I will not be responsible for the consequences.
君のしたことは僕は知らん
I can not help what you have done.
天下の大事女童の知る処にあらず
What have women and children to do with the grave affairs of state?

content:
しるし〔印〕
〈名〉
1. (=符号、記号)a mark; a sign; an indication

content.content: 何かそれを見分ける印があるか
Is there any mark or sign to know it by?
敵味方はこの印でわかる
You can tell friend from foe by this sign.
本のわからない処があったら印を付けておけ
Mark the passages that you do not understand.
訂正を要する箇所は赤インキで印がしてある
The passages to be corrected are marked with red ink―indicated with red ink.

content: 2. (=表象)an emblem; a symbol

content.content: The pine is the emblem of constancy―The pine emblematizes constancy―The pine is emblematical of constancy.
The crane and the turtle are symbols of longevity―They symbolize longevity―They are symbolical of longevity.

content: 3. (=表示)a token; a mark

content.content: in token of―as a mark of
お礼のしるしまでにさし上げるのです
Please accept this trifle in token of my gratitude.
お祝いのしるしに粗末な品を送った
I have sent him a trifling present in token of my congratulation.
賛成のしるしに寄付をした
I gave something in token of my approval―as a mark of my approval.
ほんのしるしだけの品です
It is a mere token of my goodwill.

content: 4. (=証拠)a proof; a sign

content.content: 支那では爪を伸ばすのが紳士淑女たるのしるしになっている
In China, long nails are considered as a sign of one's being a gentleman or a lady.
彼を信任したしるしに大事な用を託しておく
I entrust him with important matters in proof of my confidence.

content: 5. (=徴候)signs; symptoms; indications

content.content: 腫れるのは毒の有るしるしだ
朝焼けは雨の降るしるしだ
The morning-glow is a sign of rain.
肺病のしるしが見えますか
Has he developed any symptoms of consumption?

content: 6. (=効験)efficacy; effect

content.content: 薬のしるしが見えたか
Has the medicine taken effect?―done you good?
少しもしるしが見えない
It has no effect on me.

content: 7. (=徴章)a badge

content.content: 帽子に何かしるしを付けておったか
Did he wear any badge on his cap?

content: 8. (=商標)a trade-mark; a brand
9. (=記念品)a memento; a souvenir

content.content: 日光へ行ったしるしに何か買って行こう
I will buy something as a souvenir of my visit to Nikko.

content: 10. (=首級)the head (of an enemy)

content: 2. (=記載する)to mention; to describe; to give an account of (anything)

content.content: これは知れ切った事実だ

こんな知れ切った誤りをどうして見落としたか自分ながらわからぬ

〈形〉

content.content: 後は言わずと知れたこと

content: 2. (=些細な)trifling; inconsiderable

content.content: のろのろしているのを見ると焦れったくなるね

君は実に焦れったい人だね
You are very provoking―enough to provoke a saint.
He is an annoying fellow―an aggravating fellow.
目の前にある物が取れないと思うと実に焦れったくなる
It is tantalizing to see within my grasp what I can not get.
世の中は思うようにならないで焦れったい
何をしても思うようにいかない、ああ焦れったい
Everything I do goes wrong with me. How vexatious!

content:
じれったがる〔焦れったがる〕

content.content: 彼は焦れったがって見ておった

焦れったがって地団太踏んだ

content:
しれぬ〔知れぬ〕
〈自動〉I don't know; I can't say; there is no saying; there is no knowing; I can't think:(助動詞に訳せば)may:(副詞に訳せば)perhaps

content.content: I don't know if it is so―It may be so―Perhaps it is so.
彼は米探かも知れぬ(何とも知れぬ)
He may be a spy (for aught we know).
There is no knowing what may happen―There is no saying what may happen.
どんなに骨が折れたか知れぬ
(人のことなら)I can't think what labour it cost him―(自分のことなら)―You can't think what labour it cost me.
あんなことをする気が知れぬ
Why he should do such a thing, is more than I can tell―above my comprehension.
あんな者を女房にする気が知れぬ
There is no accounting for tastes.

〈名〉

2. (=曲物)a rogue; a rascal; a scoundrel

content:

性に合わない仕事は心身が反対する

I feel refreshed in mind and body―feel myself a new man―feel myself another man.

content:
しんずる〔信ずる〕
〈他動〉
1. (=まことと思う)to believe (one); to credit, give credit to, give credence to (a report); to persuade oneself (that it is true); to be persuaded of (one's innocence); to be convinced of (a fact); to be sure of (a fact); to accept (anything) as true; to take (one) at one's word; to take (a statement) on trust

content.content: 人の言うことを信ずる
君の言うことは信じられぬ
僕の言うことを信じ給え全く本当だから
Believe me, it is quite true.
実見しなけりゃ信じられぬ
I can not believe it, unless I see it for myself.
君はこの評判を信ずるか
Do you credit the report?―give credit to the report?―give credence to the report?
世間ではこんなばかばかしい話を信じている
People give credence to such absurd tales―Such idle tales find credence with the public.
あの人がそんなことをしようとはどうしても信じられぬ
I can not persuade myself that he has done such a thing―Such conduct on his part is beyond belief―past belief.
僕は彼を無罪だと信じている
I am persuaded that he is innocent―I am persuaded of his innocence.
あなたがそんなうまいことを仰有ると私はばかだから信じますよ
I shall take you at your word.
まあ君の言うままに信じよう
I will take you at your word―take your statement on trust.
この事実は信じて疑わぬ、固く信ずる(確信する)
I am sure of the fact―I am convinced of the fact.
Plato は霊魂は不滅だというが僕もそう信ずる
I believe with Plato that the soul is immortal.
僕の信ずるところではこの論文はあの人の手に成っている
He is the author of the article to the best of my belief.
この話は信じられぬ、信じ難い
I can not credit the story―The story is not to be credited―incredible.
その話は信じられる、信ずべき話だ
The story is to be credited―credible―It is a credible story.
この話は信ずべき筋から聞いた
I have it from a credible quarter―I have been credibly informed.
彼は人の言うことを信じやすい、軽々しく人の言うことを信ずる
He is easy of belief―ready to believe―credulous.
君は人の言うことを信じ過ぎる
You are too easy of belief―too ready to believe―too credulous―You err on the side of credulity.
彼は信じやすいから人にだまされる
As he is credulous, it is easy to deceive him―(他動詞構文にすれば)―His credulity makes it easy to deceive him.
あの人は容易に人の言うことを信ぜぬ、信じ難い
書ごとに信ずれば書無きに如かず
Better read no books than believe everything you read.

content: 2. (=信仰する)to believe in (a religion, God, a man, etc.); to have faith in (a man, a system, etc.); to trust in (Providence); to take stock in (a system)

content.content: to believe in Christianity―(初めてなら)―embrace Christianity.
君は神を信ずるか(神の存在を信ずるか)
僕は神の存在を固く信ずる
I have a firm belief in the existence of God.
君は幽霊を信ずるか(幽霊はあるものと思うか)
君は宗教は何を信ずるか
What do you believe in?―What is your religion?
皆先生を信じているから先生の言うことをきく
They obey him, for they believe in him.
僕はあの先生を信じない
I have no faith in that man.
(もとは信じたが)信じなくなった
I have lost faith in him.
世人は制度を信ずること重きに過ぎる
People put too much faith in system.
僕はこの方法を充分に信じている
I have implicit faith in this method.
僕は記憶法なるものを信ぜぬ
I have no faith in―take no stock in―mnemonic systems.

content: 3. (=信用する)to trust (a man); to put one's trust in (a man)

content.content: 彼は正直だから彼を信ずる
I trust him, for he is honest.
あなたは私を信ずるなら貴重品をお預かりしましょう
If you will put your trust in me, I will take charge of your valuables.
僕は彼を充分に信じているから万事を任せておく
I commit everything to his care, for I put implicit trust in him.
彼を信じているから金をいくらでも安心して預ける
I can trust him with any amount of money.
僕はあの男を信じないから金を預けるのは険呑だ
I can not trust him with money.

content: 4. (=信頼する)to trust to (one's honour or honesty); to rely on (one's promise)

content.content: 彼は正直だから信ずる
君は紳士だから信じよう
I will trust to your honour.
君の約束を信じよう(当てにしよう)
I shall rely on your promise.
あの人の約束は信じられぬ
He is not to be relied upon―He is unreliable.
この話は信ずべき筋から聞いた
I have the news from a reliable source―from a trustworthy quarter―on good authority.

content: 5. (=信任する)to confide in, place confidence in, repose confidence in (a man)

content.content: 主人は彼を(深く)信じている
His master confides in him―places deep confidence in him―reposes deep confidence in him.
僕は彼を信じて大事なことを託しておく
I confide in him, and entrust him with important matters.
彼は信じて大事を託するに足る男だ
生徒は教師を信ずべし

Threescore and ten is the age of man, and that but rarely.

Life is a candle flickering in the wind.

to take a wrong view of life
to look on the bright side of life
to look on the dark side of life―take a gloomy view of life

What is the end and aim of existence?

〈名〉Kindness; goodness:(=な) kind; good; obliging; accommodating; complaisant; friendly:(=に) kindly

content.content: You are very kind―It is very kind of you (to do so).
ご親切に好う言って下さいました
It is very kind of you to say so.
彼は親切でなにを頼んでもいやと言わない人だ
He is an obliging man―an accommodating man―a complaisant man.
皆が親切にしてくれる
彼女は病気中親切に世話をしてくれた
She was good to me in my illness.
皆様が頼り無い者にご親切にして下さるから嬉しゅうございます
Your people have been very friendly to a forlorn woman.
彼は親切に案内してくれた
He showed me the way kindly.
彼は親切にも案内してくれた
He kindly showed me the way―He was so kind as to show me the way―He was kind enough to show me the way―He had the kindness to show me the way.
彼女は親切にも寝ずに介抱してくれた
She kindly sat up with me―She was so good as to sit up with me―She was good enough to sit up with me―She had the goodness to sit up with me.
あれでも親切なところがある
He is kind after a fashion.
あれでもなかなか親切気の有る人だ
なんという親切気の無い人だろう
What a disobliging man he is!
僕は親切からこう言うのだ(こう言うのも老婆心だ)からどうぞ悪しからず

to show one kindness―do one a kindness
彼はいろいろ親切にしてくれた
He has done me many kindnesses.
あの人には親切を尽しても尽し甲斐が無い

to be sensible of kindness―respond to kindness
それではご親切に甘えます
Then I shall presume on your kindness.
ご親切を無にする(ほごにする)のは残念ですが

君に親切が有るなら明日来てくれ給え
If you have any kindness in you, come to see me tomorrow.
彼は親切ごかしに人をだます
He will cheat you under colour of kindness―under the mask of kindness.

1. (=気懸り)anxiety; uneasiness; concern; solicitude; alarm; trouble; distress; worry; care; a weight on one's mind:(=する) to be anxious (about some matter ―at a circumstance―for some end); to feel uneasy, make oneself uneasy, be ill at ease (about some matter―at a circumstance); to concern oneself, be concerned (about some matter―at a circumstance―for some end); to be solicitous (about some matter―at a circumstance―for some end); to be alarmed (about some matter―at a rumour); to trouble oneself, be troubled (about some matter); to distress oneself, be distressed (about some matter); to worry (oneself), be worried (about some matter); to care (about some matter); to mind (something); to be mindful of (others); to take thought for (the morrow); to have something on one's mind:(=な) anxious; uneasy; concerned; solicitous; alarmed; troubled; distressed; worried

彼は子どもの病気を心配している
君の帰りが遅いので心配した

This debt is a weight on my mind.
彼は借金をたいそう心配している

彼はいつも人のことを心配している
He is ever mindful of others.
あの銀行が破産しそうなので心配している者がある

Wealth brings with it many anxieties.
(そんなつまらぬことで心配するな)Never mind!―(そんなことは大丈夫無いから心 配するな)―Never fear!―(大事無いから心配するな)―Don't be alarmed!
あの件ならご心配に及ばぬ
You need not make yourself uneasy about that matter.
Don't make yourself uneasy about it!
何も心配することはない
There is no need of anxiety―There is no cause for anxiety.
尽くすべきことを尽くしておいたらなにも心配することはないじゃないか
Is there any cause for anxiety at all if you have done your duty?
彼の病気は心配することはない、きっと治るから
You need not make yourself uneasy about his illness,―worry about his illness,―for he must recover.

Do not concern yourself―trouble yourself―distress yourself―on my account!

彼は呑気で先のことを心配しない

to give one anxiety―cause one anxiety―occasion one anxiety―make one feel uneasy
お前のためにたいそう心配した

ご心配をかけて済みません

a weight on one's mind―to weigh on one's mind

content:
2. 
〈動詞付〉

to lose one's credit―fall into discredit

If such a report gets afloat, I shall lose my credit―my credit will suffer―(他動詞構文にすれば)―Such a report will destroy my credit―ruin my credit―crack my credit.

to keep up one's credit―maintain one's credit
世間の信用を保たねばならぬ
I must keep up my credit with the public.
先生は生徒の信用を保っている
He keeps his ground with his students.

content.content: There is moisture in the air―The air contains moisture.

These chemicals absorb moisture from the air.

content:
ずいぶん〔随分〕
〈副〉
1. (=かなり)pretty; fairy; tolerably

content.content: 英語はずいぶんうまい
He speak English fairly well―tolerably well.

content: 2. (=大いに)very; very much; quite

content.content: She is quite an old woman.
中野まではずいぶんある
It is long way to Nakano.
彼にはずいぶん会わない
I have not seen him for a long while.

content: 3. (=ずいぶんひどいの略)very hard:(反語にては)pretty

content.content: 勘定を皆人に払わせるなんてずいぶんな男だ
A pretty fellow, to make me pay all the reckonings!
(女の言葉で)あらずいぶんだわ
僕も雄弁家はずいぶん見たがあんな雄弁家は生まれてから初めてだ
I have heard many eloquent men in my time, but I never knew such eloquence in my life.
僕も辛い目に逢ったことはずいぶんあるがこんな辛い目に逢うのはへその緒切って初めてだ
I have had trying experiences in my time, but I never had such an experience in all my born days.

a first-class seaman―a second-class seaman―an ordinary seaman
